title: How to Make a Quiver for Arrows Using Cans

steps.headline: Get the first empty can.
steps.description: Remove the top using a can opener.

steps.headline: Flip the same can.
steps.description: Drill several 1/8” inch holes in the bottom. These are the quivers rain drains.

steps.headline: Flip the same can again, holes down.
steps.description: Fill the can with foam up to 2 inches (5cm). Use mattress foam or stuff with a small towel. This is the quiver's noise reducer and tip protection.

steps.headline: Prepare the other four empty cans.
steps.description: Remove tops and bottoms of each can using a can opener. Save the removed lids, as you can use the lids to make arrow heads from later.

steps.headline: Stack and superglue all four cans together.
steps.description: Glue them together one on top of the other. Add a thin ¼” thick foam rim on the top can (door/window foam works perfectly). This is the quiver's noise reducer.

steps.headline: Add the first can under the last one and glue it in place.
Duct tape the whole quiver on the outside.
steps.description: Alternatively, paint it using a primer.

steps.headline: Insert an arrow to test the foam's positioning.
Add loops or hooks to attach the straps.
Paint the quiver black.
steps.description: Add a pouch to hold extra glue, arrowheads, and fletchings.

steps.headline: Completed.
steps.description:
The arrow quiver is now ready for use. The final product fits up to eight arrows. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7a\/Make-a-Quiver-for-Arrows-Using-Cans-Step-12.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Quiver-for-Arrows-Using-Cans-Step-12.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7a\/Make-a-Quiver-for-Arrows-Using-Cans-Step-12.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Quiver-for-Arrows-Using-Cans-Step-12.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

text:
Get the first empty can. Remove the top using a can opener. Flip the same can. Drill several 1/8” inch holes in the bottom. These are the quivers rain drains. Flip the same can again, holes down. Fill the can with foam up to 2 inches (5cm). Use mattress foam or stuff with a small towel. This is the quiver's noise reducer and tip protection. Prepare the other four empty cans. Remove tops and bottoms of each can using a can opener. Save the removed lids, as you can use the lids to make arrow heads from later. Stack and superglue all four cans together. Glue them together one on top of the other. Add a thin ¼” thick foam rim on the top can (door/window foam works perfectly). This is the quiver's noise reducer. Add the first can under the last one and glue it in place. This is your base. Duct tape the whole quiver on the outside. Alternatively, paint it using a primer. Insert an arrow to test the foam's positioning. If needed, make adjustments. Add loops or hooks to attach the straps. Paint the quiver black. Add a pouch to hold extra glue, arrowheads, and fletchings. Completed. The arrow quiver is now ready for use. The final product fits up to eight arrows. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7a\/Make-a-Quiver-for-Arrows-Using-Cans-Step-12.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Quiver-for-Arrows-Using-Cans-Step-12.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7a\/Make-a-Quiver-for-Arrows-Using-Cans-Step-12.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Quiver-for-Arrows-Using-Cans-Step-12.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"
